intro: Scabiosa ucranica var. virgata, commonly known as the Ukrainian scabious, is a flowering plant native to Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in meadows and dry grasslands. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to garden ecosystems.
